--- title: "Day 2B Practice" format: html: df-print: paged --- ![](../img/making_art_2780E3.svg){.hero} ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_f533ae0ecc71bc9aa7c698d63e0357e8'} ::: ## Question 1 a) Load the `txhousing` tibble (included in \{tidyverse\}). This contains the number of homes listed (`listings`) and the typical home sales price (`median`) in multiple Texas cities and months. Create a summary tibble that contains the average number of listings and the average typical home sales price across all cities and months. *Note:* For these descriptive purposes, you can ignore missing values. b) Modify your answer to Question 1a to generate the same summary statistics but *per city* this time (still averaging across all months).

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_e206be0ca4cba20d00eb59294228f8a8'} ```{.r .cell-code} txhousing |> summarize( listings = mean(listings, na.rm = TRUE), median = mean(median, na.rm = TRUE) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: **Answer (b)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_5643da667a287a11c041524173fdb250'} ```{.r .cell-code} txhousing |> group_by(city) |> summarize( listings = mean(listings, na.rm = TRUE), median = mean(median, na.rm = TRUE) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: :::

## Question 2 For each of the following code snippets, find and fix the error(s). a) "The Scatterbrained Scatterplot" ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_358356795e3fbc0c90b900809a5547cd'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, x = displ, y = hwy) + geom_point() ``` ::: b) "Not-so-smooth Smoothing" ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_ca1730d8bdb69f104a72d7c2d25329df'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + geom_point() geom_smooth() + scale_y_continuous("Highway MPG") + scale_x_discrete("Engine Size") ``` ::: c) "A Leaky Pipeline" ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_f18845b9be2b656dad8e2fd628435dcf'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) |> geom_line() |> geom_point() ``` :::

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** The code forgot to put the mappings inside `aes()`. ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_41144034ba113c140d89117321e96484'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + # fix 1 geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (b)** The code forgot a `+` and set the x-axis to discrete instead of continuous. ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_ced48b65cab4f5e7ec45157a0dc2e5a2'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + geom_point() + # fix 1 geom_smooth() + scale_y_continuous("Highway MPG") + scale_x_continuous("Engine Size") # fix 2 #> `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (c)** The code used pipes instead of plus signs to connect ggplot2 commands. ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_386a39248ee047b9183609e54cb1d987'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(economics, aes(x = date, y = unemploy)) + # fix 1 geom_line() + # fix 2 geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 3 a) Install and load the \{palmerpenguins\} package. b) Recreate the following graphic as closely as you can from the `penguins` tibble in that package (don't worry about getting the geom settings exactly right). c) Clean up the x and y axis titles so that they are more readable (e.g., "Flipper length (mm)" instead of "flipper_length_mm"). *Bonus:* See if you can figure out how to also rename the legend title. ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_5052ba820361334107f65387ddd916a4'} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_fd01c45e787d710d2a01c9e87048784d'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Extra pane > Packages tab > Install button > palmerpenguins > Install library(palmerpenguins) ``` ::: **Answer (b)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_2cc71f4b405b345bf6d3ad0ee82be128'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)) + geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.75) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (c)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_911b628c5acc7323e80f4331550e3423'} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)) + geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.75) + scale_x_continuous(name = "Flipper length (mm)") + scale_y_continuous(name = "Body mass (g)") + scale_color_discrete(name = "Penguin species") + scale_shape_discrete(name = "Penguin species") p ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Or, use this shortcut: ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_425a1638f245c1537c75510c87cc8586'} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- ggplot(penguins, aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species, shape = species)) + geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.75) + labs( x = "Flipper length (mm)", y = "Body mass (g)", color = "Penguin species", shape_ = "Penguin species" ) p ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: :::

## Question 4 a) Use your graphic from Question 3(c) a starting graphic object. Apply the "classic" complete theme to it and move the legend to the top. *Bonus:* Also make the axis titles italic (you may need to check a cheatsheet or do some searching to find the right element). b) Export this graphic as an image file to include in a paper. Make it 6.5 inches wide and 4 inches high. *Bonus:* Open Microsoft Word or Google Docs and insert the image.

Click here for the answer key
**Answer (a)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_2109ad7a8f78807059db20dc23416355'} ```{.r .cell-code} p2 <- p + theme_classic() + theme( legend.position = "top", axis.title = element_text(face = "italic") # bonus ) p2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day2B_Practice_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: **Answer (b)** ::: {.cell hash='Day2B_Practice_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_06ca7eb6956a0529629bf360e0189659'} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave("practice.png", plot = p2, width = 6.5, height = 4, units = "in") ``` :::

## Resources - [R4DS Chapter 5](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/transform.html) (§5.6–§5.7): Read more about grouped summaries and mutates - [R4DS Chapter 12](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/tidy-data.html): Read more about reshaping and tidying data in R - [R4DS Chapter 3](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/data-visualisation.html): Read an introduction to visualization - [GGP2 Chapter 11](https://ggplot2-book.org/scale-colour.html): Read more about color in ggplot2 - [GGP2 Chapter 18](https://ggplot2-book.org/polishing.html): Read more about themes in ggplot2 ## Fun Stuff ### Let's Enhance If you want to be able to do this, save your images as `.pdf` or `.svg`... ### Don McMillan's Greatest Charts Would these be more or less funny if he had used ggplot2... ?
